meanings.definition: To fill in or make level with a shim.
meanings.sent1: He was shimming the table to stop it from wobbling.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was shimming the door frame to make it fit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was shimming its nest with tiny twigs and leaves.
meanings.sent4: She was shimming her knowledge by reading more books.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was shimming the engine to ensure smooth operation.

meanings.definition: A thin piece of material used to align or adjust parts.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a shimming to level the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She placed a shimming between the gears to make them work together.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a shimming out of his hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The friendship acted as a shimming between the two families.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut used a shimming to fix the broken equipment in space.
